Class.title: Class
Class.description: Class of system/device. Here: spectrometer, incl. detector

Type.title: Type
Type.description: Type of spectrometer: compact or non-compact

SpectrometerGeneral.title: Spectrometer
SpectrometerGeneral.description: General information on spectrometer. Compact spectrometers are defined as owing one detector, one grating, one slit. This affects some properties.

SFocalLength.title: Focal length [mm]
SFocalLength.description: Focal length of the spectrometer, e.g. 75 mm or 500 mm

SEntranceSlitWidth.title: Entrance slit width [\u00b5m]
SEntranceSlitWidth.description: Width of the entrance slit, e.g. 25 \u00b5m (interchangeable slits are ignored, e.g. Avantes). Might be given as part of the experiment metadata.

SExitSlitWidth.title: Exit slit width [\u00b5m]
SExitSlitWidth.description: Width of the exit slit\tnumber. Usually only relevant for single channel detector systems, like systems with PMT. Not relevant for compact spectrometers or OMA (optical multi-channel analyzers).

SWLresolution.title: Spectral resolution (FWHM) [nm]
SWLresolution.description: Nominal resolution of the spectrometer (FWHM). Usually only relevant for compact spectrometers (one slit, one grating, one detector), as it depends on the chosen grating and entrance slit width for other systems.

SWLCalibrationDate.title: Last wavelength calibration date
SWLCalibrationDate.description: Last wavelength calibration date of the spectrometer

Grating.title: Grating
Grating.description: One or more gratings belonging to the spectrometer

GName.title: Grating name
GName.description: Name of the grating. Some instructive name or alias (not needed for compact spectrometer)

GType.title: Grating type
GType.description: Type of the grating, e.g. 300 l/mm, holographic, etc.

GBlazeWL.title: Blaze wavelength [nm]
GBlazeWL.description: Blaze wavelength of the grating. Many gratings have a blaze wavelength (except e.g. holographic gratings).

GWLmin.title: Minimum wavelength [nm]
GWLmin.description: Minimum wavelength possible with the grating

GWLmax.title: Maximum wavelength [nm]
GWLmax.description: Maximum wavelength possible with the grating

GResolvingPower.title: Resolving power [1]
GResolvingPower.description: Resolving power of the grating. Resolving power is the more universal measure for resolution, but FWHM resolution is more intuitive.

Detector.title: Detector
Detector.description: Usually one distinct detector belonging to the spectrometer, but sometimes there might be more than one detector, which can be specified here.

DName.title: Detector name
DName.description: Name of the detector. Some instructive name or alias (not needed for compact spectrometer)

DType.title: Detector type
DType.description: Type of the detector, e.g. CCD, CMOS, PD-array (inkl. number of pixels, phosphor, photocathode, spectral sensitivity, kinetic mode, photon counting mode, pixel size, ...

DTexpmin.title: Minimum exposure time [ms]
DTexpmin.description: Minimum exposure time of the detector

DTexpmax.title: Maximum exposure time [ms]
DTexpmax.description: Maximum exposure time of the detector

DDelayMin.title: Minimum internal delay [ns]
DDelayMin.description: Minimum internal delay the detector can realize, relevant e.g. for ICCD.
